It'd be nice if the chat could show pictures / svg. It's possible! Currently you seem to be using your own HtmlContentComponent, but since 2024.2 you can use JBHtmlPane. And even if not switching to JBHtmlPane, it's possible to display an SVG with weisj/jsvg, example :

https://github.com/bric3/intellij-platform-swing-components/blob/main/components/src/main/kotlin/io/github/bric3/ij/ui/util/SvgImageExtension.kt https://github.com/bric3/intellij-platform-swing-components/blob/e87d6793e7d0dcf1a6485fc0b25cde0862c87a28/components-demo-plugin/src/main/kotlin/io/github/bric3/ij/components/demo/toolwindow/misc/MiscTab.kt#L97-L145
For those who use JetBrains editors, I recommend using the JetBrains AI Assistant instead, as it is more beneficial.

I dont understand all the recent low ratings. I have used agent mode in a VSCode before, and Rider version not so much worse. Good news that it sometimes uses IDE powers to find the errors in a code and fix it by itself. There are some bugs, but this is nightly version so it will get fixed soon i guess. Overall, finally we have agent mode in a proper IDE, so things will get better with each iteration.

Absolutely terrible experience -- constant "Oops your response got filtered" messages, sometimes it just tells you about edits its going to make and never makes them (yes this is in edit mode), the diff preview feature before accepting changes doesn't work (it shows the whole file), when you do accept changes you have to reload the files from disk before IntelliJ idea realizes the file has changed.

I've been using JetBrains IDEs for years and love their robust features. However, my experience with GitHub Copilot inside IntelliJ/Android Studio has been frustrating. Responses get unnecessarily filtered, even for standard coding tasks, disrupting my workflow. I hope JetBrains and GitHub can work together to improve Copilot's integration and filtering logic. Until then, I'm considering switching back to VS Code for Copilot work.

Me funciona bien, para ser un plugin que autocompleta código, uso magento como framework, y conoce más o menos la sintaxis, el problema viene desde la IA que usa todo el codigo disponible para generar las respuestas, a veces sugiere cosas que no van al caso pero bueno es por la tecnología que maneja, como Plugin no está nada mal, como IA deja mucho que desar
Funciona muy bien, casi igual que el nativo. Quizás le falta un poco de personalización a la hora de poder modificar el prompt para generar el message de commit.

I like the extension but the ui can be somewhat confusing when re-authorization is needed. When re-authorization is needed, the copilot "chat" view in Intellij will not show the chat, but show a text that says you are already signed in, and that you need to Authorize. And it displays an Authorize button. Clicking the Authorize button in the chat view does nothing. No errors or anything, just nothing. To "authorize" again, the only workaround I've found is to click the other Copilot icon in the Status bar of the Intellij window, then Logout. After logging out, you click the status bar Copilot icon and do a fresh Login. This will give you a new device code and a login url where you can use the code. During this sign-in from scratch, you will then be able to authorize and grant the copilot plugin permissions to work again.
Can't change commit message language, need custom prompt on commit message generation.

I guess the plugin was vibe coded without human quality checks. The agent gets stuck half of the times and is not able to provide an answer, or even an error message. Line completion stops working after a few minutes. I definitely regret paying for this.

This plugin is constantly buggy and constantly far behind its VS Code counterpart which is no doubt an intentional monopolistic practice from Microsoft as they attempt to starve out market share from their competitor and drive everyone to use their crap IDE. For months you couldn't backspace text in the chat editor. Now the LLM seems to be given none of the previous messages in your chat history as it immediately forget everything every message. A real pile of garbage that I hardly use and wouldn't touch at all if it weren't provided for free by my employer. It doesn't help that JetBrains doesn't pursue their own LLM-agnostic plugin and only see fit to forcing their crap LLMs on you through their own paid services.

There is a problem with creating and editing code, many times it can only write 1 paragraph and lose all my code below. And I also wish it could send pictures so I can take pictures of what I want it to do

Quite an impressive tool, currently helping me with a complex project that I abandoned a few years ago and I’m way further than I ever expected to get.

Answers questions well and provides good recommendations for best practice. Can give it a fairly complex query and sometimes it manages it in a single try, it’s blown me away multiple times with how simple it was and saving me potentially hours of time.

Provides good debugging code and commenting and works well when you want to tweak smaller details.

Sometimes crashes and can be very slow especially if the conversation hasn’t been cleared for a few hours. It likes to strip functionality when you’re tweaking things too, which can be really frustrating to deal with. CSS especially I’d honestly try to avoid as it takes a super long time to refine styling.

Overall it can be a great assistant and learning tool if used correctly. Wording matters more than anything as it sometimes doesn’t seem to understand, try to be as specific as possible and it generally does good.

For a beginner I probably wouldn’t bother though, definitely get some knowledge first otherwise you’ll be left confused.

I've actually really appreciated this plugin. It's great. I have only a few gripes.

  1. IntelliJ seems to be the last to get new Copilot features, which is very disappointing.
  2. Copilot flags and filters responses to a LOT of valid queries.
  3. Copilot in IntelliJ (at the time of writing) limits the context to 10 files, while vs code has removed this arbitrary limit. I'm sure this limit will be removed soon, but see point 1.

These issues may be unavoidable, because of course Copilot is owned by Microsoft, and so is vs code, so of course vs code is favored with the newest features first, but I feel these are still valid concerns.
This plugin is horrible. So buggy. I will have to switch to vs code

I was a big fan but having tried WindSurf and attempting to get similar behaviour has been very disappointing lately. Not sure what happened here but I will switch over to another AI IDE. Still love Rider itself
